{"step_by_step_thinking": "The inferior alveolar nerve block is a common procedure in dentistry. The local anesthetic (LA) is deposited near the mandibular foramen, which is located on the medial surface of the ramus of the mandible. The lingula is a small, tongue-like projection of bone that lies adjacent to the mandibular foramen. Therefore, the LA is deposited near the lingula during an inferior alveolar nerve block.", "answer_choice": "C. Lingula"}
